meanings.definition: A type of material used for constructing walls.
meanings.sent1: The workers carried heavy wallboard to build the new house.
meanings.sent2: The wallboard was smooth and easy to paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the wallboard was a giant scratching post.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like fragile wallboard, easily shattered by reality.
meanings.sent5: The wallboard, with its layers of plaster, stood strong against the storm.

meanings.definition: To cover or decorate walls with wallboard.
meanings.sent1: They will wallboard the entire room to give it a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: She wallboarded the office walls with colorful panels.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could wallboard a room in seconds with his magic wand.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to wallboard the space between them, creating an invisible barrier.
meanings.sent5: The artist wallboarded the gallery with her vibrant paintings, transforming the space.
